i1.name: Traveler's_Call
description: {{sbc|Innate - Ancient Chimes:}} '''Bard's''' presence causes sacred [[File:Traveler's Call Minimap.png|16px|link=]] {{as|chimes|buzzword2}} to appear at random locations and linger for up to 10 minutes. Collecting a {{as|chime|buzzword2}} grants '''Bard''' {{sti|ms|{{as|24% '''bonus''' movement speed}}}} [[combat status|out of combat]] for 7 seconds, stacking up to 5 times, with every other {{as|chime|buzzword2}} collected beyond the first granting an additional {{as|14% '''bonus''' movement speed}}, up to a total of {{as|80% '''bonus''' movement speed}}, {{sti|Experience|{{as|20 + (''1 per minute after 5 minutes'') experience}}}}, and {{sti|mana|{{as|12% '''maximum''' mana}}}}. '''Bard''' empowers his {{as|Meeps|buzzword3}} each time he collects 5 {{as|chimes|buzzword2}}.

{{sbc|Innate - Meeps:}} '''Bard's''' presence attracts small spirits known as {{as|Meeps|buzzword3}} to his side. {{tip|On-attack}} he consumes a {{as|Meep|buzzword3}}, dealing {{as|35|magic damage}} (''+ {{as|14|magic damage}} per 5 chimes collected'') {{as|(+ 30% AP)}} {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}}.
* At {{as|5 chimes|buzzword2}}, {{as|Meeps|buzzword3}} start {{tip|slow|slowing}} damaged enemies by {{pp|type = number of Chimes|key=%|25 to 75 for 6|5;25;45;60;75;85}} for 1 second.
* At {{as|15 chimes|buzzword2}}, {{as|Meeps|buzzword3}} deal splash damage to enemies within 150 units of his target as well as those in a cone behind them.
* At {{as|35 chimes|buzzword2}}, the cone's radius increases.

{{as|Meeps|buzzword3}} spawn every {{pp|changedisplay=true|type = number of Chimes|8 to 4 for 5|0;20;40;55;70}} seconds and '''Bard''' can keep up to {{pp|type = number of Chimes|1 to 9 for 9|0;10;30;50;65;80;90;95;100}} of them at a time.
i1.descriptionHtml:
Innate - Ancient Chimes: Bard's presence causes sacred File:Traveler's Call Minimap.png chimes to appear at random locations and linger for up to 10 minutes. Collecting a chime grants Bard 24% bonus movement speed combat status for 7 seconds, stacking up to 5 times, with every other chime collected beyond the first granting an additional 14% bonus movement speed, up to a total of 80% bonus movement speed, 20 + (1 per minute after 5 minutes) experience, and 12% maximum mana. Bard empowers his Meeps each time he collects 5 chimes.
Innate - Meeps: Bard's presence attracts small spirits known as Meeps to his side. On-attack he consumes a Meep, dealing 35 (+ 14 per 5 chimes collected) (+ 30% AP) bonus magic damage. * At 5 chimes, Meeps start slowing damaged enemies by 5;25;45;60;75;85 ‒ undefined for 1 second. * At 15 chimes, Meeps deal splash damage to enemies within 150 units of his target as well as those in a cone behind them. * At 35 chimes, the cone's radius increases.
Meeps spawn every 0;20;40;55;70 ‒ undefined seconds and Bard can keep up to 0;10;30;50;65;80;90;95;100 ‒ undefined of them at a time.
i1.notes:
* Primary target takes {{tip|spell damage}}, while secondary ones take {{tip|area damage}}.
* {{as|Meeps|buzzword3}} grant additional stacks of {{ri|Electrocute}}, {{ri|Phase Rush}} and {{ri|Conqueror}}.
* {{as|Chime|buzword2}} spawns are weighted towards the areas of the map that '''Bard''' is currently present in, and spawn every 50 seconds in pairs, with the only exception being the second and third spawns on {{tip|Summoner's Rift}}, which spawn only one.
** {{as|Chimes|buzzword2}} will not spawn in either team's base and will not spawn in the enemy team's jungle before the 5 minute mark.
* Only '''Bard''' can see a {{as|chime|buzzword2}} that is in the [[fog of war]]. All other players must have {{tip|sight}} of a {{as|chime|buzzword2}} for it to be visible to them.
** Only '''Bard''' can see a minimap icon for an uncollected {{as|chime|buzzword2}}, regardless of whether other players have vision on it or not. The minimap icon will turn red when the {{as|chime|buzzword2}} is one minute away from expiration.
** '''Bard''' cannot see {{as|chimes|buzzword2}} while {{tip|nearsight|nearsighted}}.
* Only {{as|Meep|buzzword3}} cone attacks are absorbed by {{tip|spell shield|spell shields}}. Those that deal damage together with the basic attack don't.
* If a {{as|Meep|buzzword3}} empowered auto attack is {{tip|dodged}}, {{tip|blocked}} or when '''Bard''' is {{tip|blind|blinded}}, the basic attack itself will deal no damage, but the {{as|Meep|buzzword3}} damage will still be applied.
* The empowered attack will not trigger against [[structures]] and [[ward]]s.
{{chime list}}

q1.name: Cosmic_Binding
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Bard''' fires an energy bolt in the target direction that deals {{as|magic damage}} to the first enemy hit and {{tip|slow|slows}} them by 60% for a duration.

After ''Cosmic Binding'' hits an enemy, the bolt continues behind them for {{tt|300 units|Estimated}}. If the bolt hits terrain or a second enemy, it {{tip|stun|stuns}} both targets for the same duration, dealing the same {{as|magic damage}} to the second target.
q1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Bard fires an energy bolt in the target direction that deals magic damage to the first enemy hit and slows them by 60% for a duration.
After Cosmic Binding hits an enemy, the bolt continues behind them for 300 units. If the bolt hits terrain or a second enemy, it stuns both targets for the same duration, dealing the same magic damage to the second target.
q1.notes:
* ''Cosmic Binding's'' interaction with {{tip|spell shield|spell shields}}:
** If the first target has a spell shield, they will block the damage but the bolt will still pass through them.
*** If the bolt hits a second target, only they will be stunned.
*** If the bolt hits terrain, the first target will be stunned.
** If the second target has a spell shield, they will block the stun and damage.
*** The first target will still be stunned.
** If the first target gains a spell shield after being hit, the stun will not be blocked.
* The {{tip|stun}} will apply even if the first target becomes {{tip|untargetable}}.
* ''Cosmic Binding'' can interact with [[Terrain#Player-Generated|player-generated terrain]].
* The {{tip|stun}} is still applied even if the first or second target dies to the ability itself or before the projectile can bind them.
* ''Cosmic Binding'' does not grant {{tip|sight}} of enemies hit, but a hit can be seen and heard to indicate that at least one enemy is there.
{{Effect at cast time end}}

effects.str:
• Magic Damage: (+ 65% AP)
  • Disable Duration:

w1.name: Caretaker's_Shrine
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Bard''' conjures a shrine at the target location that builds up in power over 10 seconds, granting {{tip|sight}} of a small area around it for {{tt|{{fd|1.8}} seconds|Estimated}}. Up to 3 shrines can be active at once, which last until they are destroyed by champions stepping on them.

If the champion was an ally or '''Bard''' himself, they are {{tip|heal|healed}} for an amount based on the shrine's power and gain {{sti|ms|{{as|30% '''bonus''' movement speed}}}} that decays over {{fd|1.5}} seconds.
w1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Bard conjures a shrine at the target location that builds up in power over 10 seconds, granting sight of a small area around it for 1.8 seconds. Up to 3 shrines can be active at once, which last until they are destroyed by champions stepping on them.
If the champion was an ally or Bard himself, they are healed for an amount based on the shrine's power and gain 30% bonus movement speed that decays over 1.5 seconds.
leveling: {{st|Minimum Heal|{{ap|25 to 125}} {{as|(+ 30% AP)}}|Maximum Heal|{{ap|50 to 200}} {{as|(+ 60% AP)}}}}
w1.notes:
* ''Caretaker's Shrine'' can be cast directly on an ally and it will be treated as a [[unit-targeted]] ability for effects such as {{ri|Guardian}}.
** If '''Bard''' has 3 ''shrines'' on the map and creates a new one that is cast directly on himself or an ally, the oldest shrine will not be destroyed. This is because the ''shrine'' is used as an actual targeted heal on himself or someone else, and not a permanent shrine, so the other 3 may stay.
** The [[spell indicator]] of ''Caretaker's Shrine'' shows the area in which it can be used as a targeted heal. After a shrine has been placed on the ground its activation area becomes smaller: allies or enemies have to step directly on the shrine to use it or destroy it.
* Leveling up ''Caretaker's Shrine'' will update the healing of existing shrines.

effects.str:
• Minimum Heal: (+ 30% AP)
  • Maximum Heal: (+ 60% AP)

e1.name: Magical_Journey
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Bard''' opens a one-way magical corridor through a piece of [[terrain]] in the target direction for 10 seconds. ''Magical Journey'' will not cast unless it can open a corridor.

A champion can {{tip|dash|pass}} through the corridor by selecting it, becoming {{tip|standard sight|revealed}} during the travel. '''Bard''' and allies travel through the portal at 33% increased speed.
''Magical Journey'' cannot be taken while {{tip|immobilize|immobilized}} or {{tip|ground|grounded}}.
e1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Bard opens a one-way magical corridor through a piece of terrain in the target direction for 10 seconds. Magical Journey will not cast unless it can open a corridor.
A champion can pass through the corridor by selecting it, becoming revealed during the travel. Bard and allies travel through the portal at 33% increased speed.
Magical Journey cannot be taken while immobilized or grounded.
e1.notes:
* Terrain also includes [[structures]].
* ''Magical Journey's'' tunnel has a max range of 2600 units (about two screens long)<ref>[http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/Ev3qQR4G-bard-qa?show=flat&comment=00dc0001/ Bard Q&A comment by Rabid Llama]</ref>.
* ''Magical Journey'' will score assists for '''Bard''' if an ally that uses it scores a [[kill]] or [[assist]] shortly after.
* '''Bard''' can cast ''Magical Journey'' while {{tip|ground|grounded}} or {{tip|root|rooted}}.
* There is no limit to how many times a given instance of ''Magical Journey'' may be used.
* ''Magical Journey'' cannot interact with player-created terrain due to its short lifespan.<ref>[http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/Ev3qQR4G-bard-qa?show=flat&comment=001f0000/ Bard Q&A comment by Rabid Llama]</ref>
* Any abilities that continue during normal movement, such as [[area of effect|point blank area of effects]] and various forms of {{tip|stealth}}, will continue during the travel within ''Magical Journey''.
* If a champion's {{tip|dash}} is {{tip|interrupt|interrupted}} while inside terrain using ''Magical Journey'', they will be immediately displaced out to the nearest open space, but are not rendered {{tip|airborne}}.
* Taking ''Magical Journey'' is considered a {{tip|dash}}, and so will interact with effects such as {{ri|Sudden Impact}} and {{tip|knockdown}}.

r1.name: Tempered_Fate
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Bard''' sends magical energy arcing to the target location, granting {{tip|sight}} of the area during travel. Upon impact, it puts all units within into {{tip|stasis}} for {{fd|2.5}} seconds, as well as {{tip|stun|stunning}} all enemy {{tip|champions}}, {{tip|minions}}, and {{tip|turret|turrets}} struck for the same duration. Enemies hit are {{tip|standard sight|revealed}} for the duration.
Epic {{tip|monsters}} and {{tip|turrets}} are affected by ''Tempered Fate'' despite being {{tip|cc-immune|immune to crowd control}}.
r1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Bard sends magical energy arcing to the target location, granting sight of the area during travel. Upon impact, it puts all units within into stasis for 2.5 seconds, as well as stunning all enemy champions, minions, and turrets struck for the same duration. Enemies hit are revealed for the duration.
Epic monsters and turrets are affected by Tempered Fate despite being immune to crowd control.
r1.notes:
* ''Tempered Fate's'' {{tip|stun}} is affected by {{tip|Tenacity}}.
** The {{tip|stasis}} is unaffected.
* ''Tempered Fate'' will affect all ''targetable'' {{tip|champions}}, {{tip|minions}}, {{tip|monster|monsters}}, {{tip|turret|turrets}}, {{tip|ward|wards}}, and [[jungle plants]].
* ''Tempered Fate'' has no effect on enemies that have {{tip|displacement immunity}} or {{tip|cc-immune|total crowd control immunity}}, and allies that are immune from using an ability that preloads {{tip|unstoppableforcemarker|UnstoppableForceMarker}}.
** The only exceptions are the crowd control immunity that {{tip|turret|turrets}} and epic {{tip|monsters}} have.
* All {{tip|champion|champions}} (including allies) during the {{tip|stasis}} are prohibited from activating {{tip|cleanse|cleansing}} effects for its duration.
** It will not disable [[File: Quicksilver Sash item.png|20px|link=]] {{nie|Quicksilver}} and instead put it on a 3-second {{sti|cooldown}}.
* ''Tempered Fate'' deals 0 {{tip|proc damage|proc}} {{tip|true damage}}, which triggers [[combat status|in-combat]] effects such as drawing turret and [[Monster#Monster_Behavior|monster aggression]], {{ri|Sudden Impact}} or applying {{ii|Night Harvester}} and {{ii|Elixir of Sorcery}}.
** {{ii|Elixir of Sorcery}} deals damage before the target is put into stasis.
* ''Tempered Fate's'' travel time varies between ~{{fd|0.65}} at point blank and ~{{fd|1.8}} at max range, resulting in an overall delay of ~{{fd|1.15}}-{{fd|2.3}} seconds including the cast time depending on distance covered.
